results.title: Game Masters: Yu Suzuki interview
results.creator_credit: Richard Greenhalgh, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Yu Suzuki talks about his body of work which is one of the most diverse in the industry, ranging from the adrenalin rushes of his early arcade hits ‘Space Harrier’ (1985) and ‘Hang-On’ (1985) to the console adventure epic ‘Shenmue’ (1999).

As the pioneer of immersive, full-body arcade games, Suzuki has never been afraid to explore fantasy, reality and every shade of virtual experience in between.

In 1999, Suzuki moved away from arcades to create ‘Shenmue’ (1999), an open-world adventure for the Dreamcast. ‘Shenmue’ was recognised at the time as one of the most expansive and detailed videogames ever made; it pioneered the ‘open city’ subgenre of open-world games.

NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Greenhalgh, ACMI Content Development and ACMI

results.title: Game Masters: Yuji Naka interview
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Yuji Naka is a videogame designer and programmer, best known as the former head of Sonic Team, where he was the lead programmer of the original ‘Sonic the Hedgehog’. Naka reveals his initial desire to make arcade games and the influence that Yu Suzuki has had on his career as a programmer. Since 2006 he has been the head of Prope, an independent game company he founded after leaving SEGA.
Yuji gives great insights into the development and creation of ‘Sonic the Hedgehog 1 and 2’, ‘Nights into Dreams’ and ‘Chu Chu Rocket’.
NB: This interview was conducted in Yuji Naka’s native language of Japanese and features English subtitles. Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Gracia Baylor
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gracia Baylor was the first woman President of the Shire of Healesville, now Yarra Ranges Shire Council, and one of the first two women to be elected to the Victorian Legislative Council. Gracia has been an active leader of women’s organisations, including President of the National Council of Women (NCW) of Victoria 1990-93 and President of NCW Australia 1997-2000. In 1999, Gracia was made a Member of the Order of Australia (AM) in recognition of her services to Parliament and women’s affairs. She is a member of two Federal Government Advisory Committees.

In 1999, Gracia was made a Member of the Order of Australia (AM) in recognition of her services to Parliament and women’s affairs. She is a member of two Federal Government Advisory Committees.

results.title: In conversation with D.I.Y Art Films
results.brief_description:
Chris Pahlow, Stephanie Brotchie and Maia Tarrell from D.I.Y Art Films talk about the making of their animation ‘Supermarket Musical Massacre’.
Interview recorded as part of the ‘Melbourne International Animation Festival 2008’.

results.title: In conversation with Graham Leader
results.brief_description:
‘Heartworn Highways’ (1981) captures singer-songwriters such as Townes Van Zandt, Guy Clark, Rodney Crowell, a young Steve Earle and Steve Young living and performing in the heart of pure Country.
Producer Graham Leader talks about the genesis of the documentary ‘Heartworn Highways’. Interview recorded as part of ‘Drifters, Dreamers and Cowboys’ 24 November 2008.

results.title: Dur-e Dara
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dur-e Dara has a long and accomplished career in the food industry and is the first woman President of the Restaurant and Caterers Association of Victoria. Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.
results.description: Dur-e Dara has a long and accomplished career in the food industry and is the first woman President of the Restaurant and Caterers Association of Victoria. Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.

She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.

results.title: Strong and Proud
results.creator_credit: Darren Atkinson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Darren grew up on Cummeragunja Mission and in this digital story he talks about his grandfather’s life, the Koori community and the handing down of Indigenous traditions and culture from one generation to the next.

results.title: Black ash
results.brief_description: An account of a typical ‘lazy day’ by the river in Warburton which suddenly turns nasty when Bonnie and her friends realise the gravity of the fire. She recounts her anxiety and wanting to leave Warburton and her frustration at her family’s indecisions. She is stuck in Lysterfield after they evacuate with 17 people.

results.title: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis is the current Chair for the Federation of Ethnic Communities’ Councils of Australia (FECCA) an Honour Roll inductee and Member of the Order of Australia (AM). She co-founded the Victorian Immigrant and Refugee Women’s Coalition (VIRWC) and has served as Chair of the Immigrant Women’s Domestic Violence Service, as Inaugural Chair of the Women in the North Service, as Council member at the RMIT University, as well as on a number of State and Federal advisory and policy structures.

results.title: A Day to remember
results.brief_description: A young CFA volunteer who spent her 21st birthday on duty during the bushfires of February 2009. Her entire family is involved in the CFA as volunteer firefighters. She speaks about the poignancy of seeing an Australian flag on a resident’s home during ‘Black Saturday’.
